intro: Bidens graveolens, commonly known as Mexican ironweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It features slender, upright stems that are often hairy and can grow up to 1 meter in height. The plant produces small, yellow flowers with two white-petaled rays, which bloom in clusters at the top of the stems. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and have serrated edges. Bidens graveolens is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and along stream banks.
